queryinfo:
<DataSets><DataSet Name="UserInfo"><Timeout /><CommandText>select fullname 
from FilteredSystemUser 
where systemuserid = dbo.fn_FindUserGuid()</CommandText></DataSet><DataSet Name="DSSystemUsers"><Timeout /><CommandText>Declare @SQL nVarchar(4000)

SET @SQL = ' 

SELECT role.name, 
    cast(systemuser.systemuserid as nvarchar(50)) as systemuserid, 
    fullname, title, internalemailaddress, address1_telephone1, systemuser.businessunitidname, systemuser.businessunitid

FROM (' + @CRM_FilteredSystemUser + ') AS systemuser
    LEFT JOIN FilteredSystemUserRoles AS userroles on systemuser.systemuserid = userroles.systemuserid
    LEFT JOIN FilteredRole AS role on role.roleid = userroles.roleid
where  domainname is not null and domainname <> '''' and accessmode <> 3
ORDER BY systemuser.businessunitidname, fullname '

EXEC(@SQL)</CommandText></DataSet><DataSet Name="DSNumandCurrency"><Timeout /><CommandText>select * from dbo.fn_GetFormatStrings()</CommandText></DataSet></DataSets>

Name="DSAccountSummary"><Query><rd:UseGenericDesigner>true</rd:UseGenericDesigner><CommandText>Declare @StartDate DateTime
Declare @EndDate DateTime

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Last 12 months'
begin
set @StartDate = DateAdd(M, -12, getutcdate())
set @EndDate = getutcdate()
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Last 6 months'
begin
set @StartDate = DateAdd(M, -6, getutcdate())
set @EndDate = getutcdate()
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Last 90 days'
begin
set @StartDate = DateAdd(d, -90, getutcdate())
set @EndDate = getutcdate()
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Last 30 days'
begin
set @StartDate = DateAdd(d, -30, getutcdate())
set @EndDate = getutcdate()
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Last 7 days'
begin
set @StartDate = DateAdd(d, -7, getutcdate())
set @EndDate = getutcdate()
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Yesterday'
begin
set @StartDate =dbo.fn_BeginOfYesterday(getutcdate())
set @EndDate =dbo.fn_EndOfYesterday(getutcdate())
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Today'
begin
set @StartDate = dbo.fn_BeginOfToday(getutcdate())
set @EndDate = dbo.fn_EndOfToday(getutcdate())
end
if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Tomorrow'
begin
set @StartDate = dbo.fn_BeginOfTomorrow(getutcdate())
set @EndDate= dbo.fn_EndOfTomorrow(getutcdate())
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Next 7 days'
begin
set @StartDate = getutcdate()
set @EndDate = DateAdd(d, 7, getutcdate())
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Next 30 days'
begin
set @StartDate = getutcdate()
set @EndDate = DateAdd(d, 30, getutcdate())
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Next 90 days'
begin
set @StartDate = getutcdate()
set @EndDate = DateAdd(d, 90, getutcdate())
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Next 6 months'
begin
set @StartDate = getutcdate()
set @EndDate = DateAdd(m, 6, getutcdate())
end
if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Next 12 months'
begin
set @StartDate = getutcdate()
set @EndDate = DateAdd(m, 12, getutcdate())
end
if @CRM_DateFilter = 'All'
begin
set @StartDate = '1/1/1900'
set @EndDate = '1/1/9999'
end



declare @AcctDepth int
declare @ContactDepth int
set @AcctDepth = 3
set @ContactDepth = 3

Create Table #TempRollupIds(rollupid uniqueidentifier PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED,
				type int,
				regardingid uniqueidentifier,
				source int,
				ownerid uniqueidentifier,
				owneridname nvarchar(max),
				createdon datetime,
				[description] ntext,
				subject nvarchar(max),
				statuscodename nvarchar(max),
				regarding nvarchar(max)
				)

Create statistics rptacctsummarystat on #TempRollupIds(rollupid)

exec p_AccountSummaryRollup @CRM_Acct,@CRM_SubAcct,@AcctDepth, 1 ,@ContactDepth,@CRM_DisplayRelatedEntities,@StartDate,@EndDate,@CRM_DisplayNotes

select * from #TempRollupIds where type not in (1,2)


Drop Table #TempRollupIds</CommandText><QueryParameters><QueryParameter Name="@CRM_DateFilter"><Value>=Parameters!CRM_DateFilter.Value</Value></QueryParameter><QueryParameter Name="DSAccountSummary"><Query><rd:UseGenericDesigner>true</rd:UseGenericDesigner><CommandText>Declare @StartDate DateTime
Declare @EndDate DateTime

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Last 12 months'
begin
set @StartDate = DateAdd(M, -12, getutcdate())
set @EndDate = getutcdate()
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Last 6 months'
begin
set @StartDate = DateAdd(M, -6, getutcdate())
set @EndDate = getutcdate()
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Last 90 days'
begin
set @StartDate = DateAdd(d, -90, getutcdate())
set @EndDate = getutcdate()
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Last 30 days'
begin
set @StartDate = DateAdd(d, -30, getutcdate())
set @EndDate = getutcdate()
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Last 7 days'
begin
set @StartDate = DateAdd(d, -7, getutcdate())
set @EndDate = getutcdate()
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Yesterday'
begin
set @StartDate =dbo.fn_BeginOfYesterday(getutcdate())
set @EndDate =dbo.fn_EndOfYesterday(getutcdate())
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Today'
begin
set @StartDate = dbo.fn_BeginOfToday(getutcdate())
set @EndDate = dbo.fn_EndOfToday(getutcdate())
end
if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Tomorrow'
begin
set @StartDate = dbo.fn_BeginOfTomorrow(getutcdate())
set @EndDate= dbo.fn_EndOfTomorrow(getutcdate())
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Next 7 days'
begin
set @StartDate = getutcdate()
set @EndDate = DateAdd(d, 7, getutcdate())
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Next 30 days'
begin
set @StartDate = getutcdate()
set @EndDate = DateAdd(d, 30, getutcdate())
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Next 90 days'
begin
set @StartDate = getutcdate()
set @EndDate = DateAdd(d, 90, getutcdate())
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Next 6 months'
begin
set @StartDate = getutcdate()
set @EndDate = DateAdd(m, 6, getutcdate())
end
if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Next 12 months'
begin
set @StartDate = getutcdate()
set @EndDate = DateAdd(m, 12, getutcdate())
end
if @CRM_DateFilter = 'All'
begin
set @StartDate = '1/1/1900'
set @EndDate = '1/1/9999'
end



declare @AcctDepth int
declare @ContactDepth int
set @AcctDepth = 3
set @ContactDepth = 3

Create Table #TempRollupIds(rollupid uniqueidentifier PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED,
				type int,
				regardingid uniqueidentifier,
				source int,
				ownerid uniqueidentifier,
				owneridname nvarchar(max),
				createdon datetime,
				[description] ntext,
				subject nvarchar(max),
				statuscodename nvarchar(max),
				regarding nvarchar(max)
				)

Create statistics rptacctsummarystat on #TempRollupIds(rollupid)

exec p_AccountSummaryRollup @CRM_Acct,@CRM_SubAcct,@AcctDepth, 1 ,@ContactDepth,@CRM_DisplayRelatedEntities,@StartDate,@EndDate,@CRM_DisplayNotes

select * from #TempRollupIds where type not in (1,2)

<DataSets><DataSet Name="UserInfo"><Timeout /><CommandText>select fullname from FilteredSystemUser where systemuserid = dbo.fn_FindUserGuid()</CommandText></DataSet><DataSet Name="NumberandCurrencyFormat"><Timeout /><CommandText>select * from dbo.fn_GetFormatStrings()</CommandText></DataSet><DataSet Name="DSAccountSummary"><Timeout /><CommandText>Declare @StartDate DateTime
Declare @EndDate DateTime

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Last 12 months'
begin
set @StartDate = DateAdd(M, -12, getutcdate())
set @EndDate = getutcdate()
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Last 6 months'
begin
set @StartDate = DateAdd(M, -6, getutcdate())
set @EndDate = getutcdate()
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Last 90 days'
begin
set @StartDate = DateAdd(d, -90, getutcdate())
set @EndDate = getutcdate()
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Last 30 days'
begin
set @StartDate = DateAdd(d, -30, getutcdate())
set @EndDate = getutcdate()
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Last 7 days'
begin
set @StartDate = DateAdd(d, -7, getutcdate())
set @EndDate = getutcdate()
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Yesterday'
begin
set @StartDate =dbo.fn_BeginOfYesterday(getutcdate())
set @EndDate =dbo.fn_EndOfYesterday(getutcdate())
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Today'
begin
set @StartDate = dbo.fn_BeginOfToday(getutcdate())
set @EndDate = dbo.fn_EndOfToday(getutcdate())
end
if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Tomorrow'
begin
set @StartDate = dbo.fn_BeginOfTomorrow(getutcdate())
set @EndDate= dbo.fn_EndOfTomorrow(getutcdate())
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Next 7 days'
begin
set @StartDate = getutcdate()
set @EndDate = DateAdd(d, 7, getutcdate())
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Next 30 days'
begin
set @StartDate = getutcdate()
set @EndDate = DateAdd(d, 30, getutcdate())
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Next 90 days'
begin
set @StartDate = getutcdate()
set @EndDate = DateAdd(d, 90, getutcdate())
end

if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Next 6 months'
begin
set @StartDate = getutcdate()
set @EndDate = DateAdd(m, 6, getutcdate())
end
if @CRM_DateFilter = 'Next 12 months'
begin
set @StartDate = getutcdate()
set @EndDate = DateAdd(m, 12, getutcdate())
end
if @CRM_DateFilter = 'All'
begin
set @StartDate = '1/1/1900'
set @EndDate = '1/1/9999'
end



declare @AcctDepth int
declare @ContactDepth int
set @AcctDepth = 3
set @ContactDepth = 3

Create Table #TempRollupIds(rollupid uniqueidentifier PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED,
				type int,
				regardingid uniqueidentifier,
				source int,
				ownerid uniqueidentifier,
				owneridname nvarchar(max),
				createdon datetime,
				[description] ntext,
				subject nvarchar(max),
				statuscodename nvarchar(max),
				regarding nvarchar(max)
				)

Create statistics rptacctsummarystat on #TempRollupIds(rollupid)

exec p_AccountSummaryRollup @CRM_Acct,@CRM_SubAcct,@AcctDepth, 1 ,@ContactDepth,@CRM_DisplayRelatedEntities,@StartDate,@EndDate,@CRM_DisplayNotes

select * from #TempRollupIds where type not in (1,2)


Drop Table #TempRollupIds</CommandText></DataSet></DataSets>

        Declare @SQL nVarchar(max)
        
        -- If an nVarchar(max) var is assigned using a concatenation of constant-length values, the result will be truncated to maintain
        -- backward compatibility with SQL Server 2000.  SQL's recommended workaround is to ensure that one of the concatenated values
        -- is of type nVarchar(max).  To address this, use @EmptyNvarcharMax in all assignments of @SQL1 and @SQL2 (proactively, in the
        -- case they aren't already assigned using concatenation).
        Declare @EmptyNvarcharMax nVarchar(max)
        Set @EmptyNvarcharMax = ''
        
        set @sql = @EmptyNvarcharMax + 'if exists (' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ')
                    begin
                      SELECT DISTINCT
                      FilteredMetric.metricid
                     ,FilteredMetric.isamount
                     ,FilteredMetric.isamountname
                     ,FilteredMetric.amountdatatype
                     ,FilteredMetric.amountdatatypename
                     ,FilteredMetric.name
                     FROM
                     FilteredMetric  INNER JOIN (' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ') as FilteredGoal
                      ON
                     FilteredMetric.metricid = FilteredGoal.metricid
                    end
                    else
                    begin
                      SELECT QuoteName(''00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000'') AS [metricid],QuoteName( '''') as [name]
                    end'
        exec(@SQL)
       </CommandText><QueryParameters><QueryParameter Name="@CRM_FilteredGoal"><Value>=Parameters!CRM_FilteredGoal.Value</Value></QueryParameter></QueryParameters><rd:UseGenericDesigner>true</rd:UseGenericDesigner></Query></DataSet><DataSet Name="DataSet3"><Fields><Field Name="amountdatatype"><DataField>amountdatatype</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Int32</rd:TypeName></Field></Fields><Query><DataSourceName>crmorg_MSCRM</DataSourceName><CommandText>if(CHARINDEX('[', @metricid) != 0)
						set @metricid = SUBSTRING(@metricid, 2, 36)
        select coalesce(
(SELECT FilteredMetric.amountdatatype
FROM
  FilteredMetric
where metricid =@metricid), 2) as amountdatatype</CommandText><QueryParameters><QueryParameter Name="@metricid"><Value>=Parameters!metricid.Value</Value></QueryParameter></QueryParameters><rd:UseGenericDesigner>true</rd:UseGenericDesigner></Query></DataSet><DataSet Name="DataSetForGoalChart"><Fields><Field Name="actualdecimal"><DataField>actualdecimal</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Decimal</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="actualinteger"><DataField>actualinteger</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Int32</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="actualmoney"><DataField>actualmoney</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Decimal</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="inprogressdecimal"><DataField>inprogressdecimal</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Decimal</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="inprogressinteger"><DataField>inprogressinteger</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Int32</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="inprogressmoney"><DataField>inprogressmoney</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Decimal</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="targetdecimal"><DataField>targetdecimal</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Decimal</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="targetinteger"><DataField>targetinteger</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Int32</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="targetmoney"><DataField>targetmoney</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Decimal</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="title"><DataField>title</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.String</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="transactioncurrencyid"><DataField>transactioncurrencyid</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Guid</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="transactioncurrencyidname"><DataField>transactioncurrencyidname</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.String</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="metricid"><DataField>metricid</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Guid</rd:TypeName></Field></Fields><Query><DataSourceName>crmorg_MSCRM</DataSourceName><CommandText>
Declare @SQL nVarchar(max)

-- If an nVarchar(max) var is assigned using a concatenation of constant-length values, the result will be truncated to maintain
-- backward compatibility with SQL Server 2000.  SQL's recommended workaround is to ensure that one of the concatenated values
-- is of type nVarchar(max).  To address this, use @EmptyNvarcharMax in all assignments of @SQL1 and @SQL2 (proactively, in the
-- case they aren't already assigned using concatenation).
Declare @EmptyNvarcharMax nVarchar(max)
Set @EmptyNvarcharMax = ''

if(CHARINDEX('[', @metricid) != 0)
	set @metricid = SUBSTRING(@metricid, 2, 36)
set @sql = @EmptyNvarcharMax + 'SELECT
FilteredGoal.actualdecimal
,FilteredGoal.actualinteger
,FilteredGoal.actualmoney
,FilteredGoal.inprogressdecimal
,FilteredGoal.inprogressinteger
,FilteredGoal.inprogressmoney
,FilteredGoal.targetdecimal
,FilteredGoal.targetinteger
,FilteredGoal.targetmoney
,FilteredGoal.title
,FilteredGoal.transactioncurrencyid
,FilteredGoal.transactioncurrencyidname
,FilteredGoal.metricid
FROM
(' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ') as FilteredGoal
WHERE
FilteredGoal.metricid = ' + ''''+@metricid+''''
+ 'and
(FilteredGoal.statuscode != 2 or FilteredGoal.statecode != 1) and 
(FilteredGoal.parentgoalid IS Null
or
(FilteredGoal.parentgoalid not in (SELECT
goalid
FROM
(' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ') as FilteredGoal
WHERE
FilteredGoal.metricid = '+ ''''+@metricid+'''' + '
))
)'
exec(@SQL)
		</CommandText><QueryParameters><QueryParameter Name="@metricid"><Value>=Parameters!metricid.Value</Value></QueryParameter><QueryParameter         Declare @SQL nVarchar(max)
        
        -- If an nVarchar(max) var is assigned using a concatenation of constant-length values, the result will be truncated to maintain
        -- backward compatibility with SQL Server 2000.  SQL's recommended workaround is to ensure that one of the concatenated values

        -- case they aren't already assigned using concatenation).
        Declare @EmptyNvarcharMax nVarchar(max)
        Set @EmptyNvarcharMax = ''
        
        set @sql = @EmptyNvarcharMax + 'if exists (' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ')
                    begin
                      SELECT DISTINCT
                      FilteredMetric.metricid
                     ,FilteredMetric.isamount
                     ,FilteredMetric.isamountname
                     ,FilteredMetric.amountdatatype
                     ,FilteredMetric.amountdatatypename
                     ,FilteredMetric.name
                     FROM
                     FilteredMetric  INNER JOIN (' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ') as FilteredGoal
                      ON
                     FilteredMetric.metricid = FilteredGoal.metricid
                    end
                    else
                    begin
                      SELECT QuoteName(''00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000'') AS [metricid],QuoteName( '''') as [name]
                    end'
        exec(@SQL)
       </CommandText><QueryParameters><QueryParameter Name="@CRM_FilteredGoal"><Value>=Parameters!CRM_FilteredGoal.Value</Value></QueryParameter></QueryParameters><rd:UseGenericDesigner>true</rd:UseGenericDesigner></Query></DataSet><DataSet Name="DataSet3"><Fields><Field Name="amountdatatype"><DataField>amountdatatype</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Int32</rd:TypeName></Field></Fields><Query><DataSourceName>crmorg_MSCRM</DataSourceName><CommandText>if(CHARINDEX('[', @metricid) != 0)
						set @metricid = SUBSTRING(@metricid, 2, 36)
        select coalesce(
(SELECT FilteredMetric.amountdatatype
FROM

where metricid =@metricid), 2) as amountdatatype</CommandText><QueryParameters><QueryParameter Name="@metricid"><Value>=Parameters!metricid.Value</Value></QueryParameter></QueryParameters><rd:UseGenericDesigner>true</rd:UseGenericDesigner></Query></DataSet><DataSet Name="DataSetForGoalChart"><Fields><Field Name="actualdecimal"><DataField>actualdecimal</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Decimal</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="actualinteger"><DataField>actualinteger</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Int32</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="actualmoney"><DataField>actualmoney</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Decimal</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="inprogressdecimal"><DataField>inprogressdecimal</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Decimal</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="inprogressinteger"><DataField>inprogressinteger</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Int32</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="inprogressmoney"><DataField>inprogressmoney</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Decimal</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="targetdecimal"><DataField>targetdecimal</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Decimal</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="targetinteger"><DataField>targetinteger</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Int32</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="targetmoney"><DataField>targetmoney</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Decimal</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="title"><DataField>title</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.String</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="transactioncurrencyid"><DataField>transactioncurrencyid</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Guid</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="transactioncurrencyidname"><DataField>transactioncurrencyidname</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.String</rd:TypeName></Field><Field Name="metricid"><DataField>metricid</DataField><rd:TypeName>System.Guid</rd:TypeName></Field></Fields><Query><DataSourceName>crmorg_MSCRM</DataSourceName><CommandText>
Declare @SQL nVarchar(max)

-- If an nVarchar(max) var is assigned using a concatenation of constant-length values, the result will be truncated to maintain
-- backward compatibility with SQL Server 2000.  SQL's recommended workaround is to ensure that one of the concatenated values
-- is of type nVarchar(max).  To address this, use @EmptyNvarcharMax in all assignments of @SQL1 and @SQL2 (proactively, in the
-- case they aren't already assigned using concatenation).
Declare @EmptyNvarcharMax nVarchar(max)
Set @EmptyNvarcharMax = ''

if(CHARINDEX('[', @metricid) != 0)
	set @metricid = SUBSTRING(@metricid, 2, 36)
set @sql = @EmptyNvarcharMax + 'SELECT
FilteredGoal.actualdecimal
,FilteredGoal.actualinteger
,FilteredGoal.actualmoney
,FilteredGoal.inprogressdecimal
,FilteredGoal.inprogressinteger
,FilteredGoal.inprogressmoney
,FilteredGoal.targetdecimal
,FilteredGoal.targetinteger
,FilteredGoal.targetmoney
,FilteredGoal.title
,FilteredGoal.transactioncurrencyid
,FilteredGoal.transactioncurrencyidname
,FilteredGoal.metricid
FROM
(' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ') as FilteredGoal
WHERE
FilteredGoal.metricid = ' + ''''+@metricid+''''
+ 'and
(FilteredGoal.statuscode != 2 or FilteredGoal.statecode != 1) and 
(FilteredGoal.parentgoalid IS Null
or
(FilteredGoal.parentgoalid not in (SELECT
goalid
FROM
(' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ') as FilteredGoal
WHERE
FilteredGoal.metricid = '+ ''''+@metricid+'''' + '
))
)'
exec(@SQL)
		</CommandText><QueryParameters><QueryParameter Name="@metricid"><Value>=Parameters!metricid.Value</Value></QueryParameter><QueryParameter <DataSets><DataSet Name="DataSet1"><Timeout /><CommandText>Declare @SQL nVarchar(max)
		
-- If an nVarchar(max) var is assigned using a concatenation of constant-length values, the result will be truncated to maintain
-- backward compatibility with SQL Server 2000.  SQL's recommended workaround is to ensure that one of the concatenated values
-- is of type nVarchar(max).  To address this, use @EmptyNvarcharMax in all assignments of @SQL1 and @SQL2 (proactively, in the
-- case they aren't already assigned using concatenation).
Declare @EmptyNvarcharMax nVarchar(max)
Set @EmptyNvarcharMax = ''
		
			if(CHARINDEX('[', @metricid) != 0)
				set @metricid = SUBSTRING(@metricid, 2, 36)
set @sql = @EmptyNvarcharMax + 'SELECT
  FilteredGoal.actualmoney
  ,FilteredGoal.inprogressmoney
  ,FilteredGoal.goalowneridname
  ,FilteredGoal.goalowneridyominame
  ,FilteredGoal.parentgoalid
  ,FilteredGoal.parentgoalidname
  ,FilteredGoal.targetmoney
  ,FilteredGoal.title
  ,FilteredGoal.goalstartdate
  ,FilteredGoal.goalenddate
  ,FilteredGoal.fiscalyear
  ,FilteredGoal.fiscalyearname
  ,FilteredGoal.fiscalperiod
  ,FilteredGoal.fiscalperiodname
  ,FilteredGoal.goalid
  ,FilteredGoal.metricid
  ,FilteredGoal.metricidname
  ,FilteredGoal.isamount
  ,FilteredGoal.amountdatatype
  ,FilteredGoal.amountdatatypename
  ,FilteredGoal.isamountname
  ,FilteredGoal.treeid
  ,FilteredGoal.inprogressdecimal
  ,FilteredGoal.inprogressinteger
  ,FilteredGoal.actualinteger
  ,FilteredGoal.actualdecimal
  ,FilteredGoal.targetdecimal
  ,FilteredGoal.targetinteger
FROM
  (' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ') as FilteredGoal where metricid=' + ''''+@metricid+''' and (FilteredGoal.statuscode != 2 or FilteredGoal.statecode != 1)'


Exec(@SQL)</CommandText></DataSet><DataSet Name="DataSet2"><Timeout /><CommandText>
        Declare @SQL nVarchar(max)
        
        -- If an nVarchar(max) var is assigned using a concatenation of constant-length values, the result will be truncated to maintain
        -- backward compatibility with SQL Server 2000.  SQL's recommended workaround is to ensure that one of the concatenated values
        -- is of type nVarchar(max).  To address this, use @EmptyNvarcharMax in all assignments of @SQL1 and @SQL2 (proactively, in the
        -- case they aren't already assigned using concatenation).
        Declare @EmptyNvarcharMax nVarchar(max)
        Set @EmptyNvarcharMax = ''
        
        set @sql = @EmptyNvarcharMax + 'if exists (' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ')
                    begin
                      SELECT DISTINCT
                      FilteredMetric.metricid
                     ,FilteredMetric.isamount
                     ,FilteredMetric.isamountname
                     ,FilteredMetric.amountdatatype
                     ,FilteredMetric.amountdatatypename
                     ,FilteredMetric.name
                     FROM
                     FilteredMetric  INNER JOIN (' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ') as FilteredGoal
                      ON
                     FilteredMetric.metricid = FilteredGoal.metricid
                    end
                    else
                    begin
                      SELECT QuoteName(''00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000'') AS [metricid],QuoteName( '''') as [name]
                    end'
        exec(@SQL)
       </CommandText></DataSet><DataSet Name="DataSet3"><Timeout /><CommandText>if(CHARINDEX('[', @metricid) != 0)
						set @metricid = SUBSTRING(@metricid, 2, 36)
        select coalesce(
(SELECT FilteredMetric.amountdatatype
FROM
  FilteredMetric
where metricid =@metricid), 2) as amountdatatype</CommandText></DataSet><DataSet Name="DataSetForGoalChart"><Timeout /><CommandText>
Declare @SQL nVarchar(max)

-- If an nVarchar(max) var is assigned using a concatenation of constant-length values, the result will be truncated to maintain
-- backward compatibility with SQL Server 2000.  SQL's recommended workaround is to ensure that one of the concatenated values
-- is of type nVarchar(max).  To address this, use @EmptyNvarcharMax in all assignments of @SQL1 and @SQL2 (proactively, in the
-- case they aren't already assigned using concatenation).
Declare @EmptyNvarcharMax nVarchar(max)
Set @EmptyNvarcharMax = ''

if(CHARINDEX('[', @metricid) != 0)
	set @metricid = SUBSTRING(@metricid, 2, 36)
set @sql = @EmptyNvarcharMax + 'SELECT
FilteredGoal.actualdecimal
,FilteredGoal.actualinteger
,FilteredGoal.actualmoney
,FilteredGoal.inprogressdecimal
,FilteredGoal.inprogressinteger
,FilteredGoal.inprogressmoney
,FilteredGoal.targetdecimal
,FilteredGoal.targetinteger
,FilteredGoal.targetmoney
,FilteredGoal.title
,FilteredGoal.transactioncurrencyid
,FilteredGoal.transactioncurrencyidname
,FilteredGoal.metricid
FROM
(' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ') as FilteredGoal
WHERE
FilteredGoal.metricid = ' + ''''+@metricid+''''
+ 'and
(FilteredGoal.statuscode != 2 or FilteredGoal.statecode != 1) and 
(FilteredGoal.parentgoalid IS Null
or
(FilteredGoal.parentgoalid not in (SELECT
goalid
FROM
(' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ') as FilteredGoal
WHERE
FilteredGoal.metricid = '+ ''''+@metricid+'''' + '
))
)'
exec(@SQL)
		</CommandText></DataSet><DataSet Name="UserInfo"><Timeout /><CommandText>select fullname from FilteredSystemUser where systemuserid = dbo.fn_FindUserGuid()</CommandText></DataSet><DataSet Name="NumberandCurrencyFormat"><Timeout /><CommandText>select * from dbo.fn_GetFormatStrings()</CommandText></DataSet></DataSets>

          ,FilteredGoal.isamount
          ,FilteredGoal.amountdatatype
          ,FilteredGoal.amountdatatypename
          ,FilteredGoal.isamountname
          ,FilteredGoal.treeid
          ,FilteredGoal.inprogressdecimal
          ,FilteredGoal.inprogressinteger
          ,FilteredGoal.actualinteger
          ,FilteredGoal.actualdecimal
          ,FilteredGoal.targetdecimal
          ,FilteredGoal.targetinteger
          FROM
          (' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ') as FilteredGoal where goalid =' +  ''''+@goalid+''''
          + ' or
          FilteredGoal.parentgoalid =' + ''''+@goalid+''''
          + ' and (FilteredGoal.statuscode != 2 or FilteredGoal.statecode != 1)'
          Exec(@SQL)
        </CommandText><QueryParameters><QueryParameter Name="@goalid"><Value>=Parameters!goalid.Value</Value></QueryParameter><QueryParameter           Declare @SQL nVarchar(max)
          
          -- If an nVarchar(max) var is assigned using a concatenation of constant-length values, the result will be truncated to maintain
          -- backward compatibility with SQL Server 2000.  SQL's recommended workaround is to ensure that one of the concatenated values
          -- is of type nVarchar(max).  To address this, use @EmptyNvarcharMax in all assignments of @SQL1 and @SQL2 (proactively, in the
          -- case they aren't already assigned using concatenation).
          Declare @EmptyNvarcharMax nVarchar(max)
          Set @EmptyNvarcharMax = ''

          set @sql = @EmptyNvarcharMax + '
          with traverseSubTrees( title, goalowneridname, fiscalyearname, fiscalperiodname, goalstartdate, goalenddate,targetmoney, actualmoney, inprogressmoney, targetdecimal, actualdecimal, inprogressdecimal, targetinteger, actualinteger, inprogressinteger, goalId, parentgoalid)As
          (
          --Anchor member
          Select title, goalowneridname, fiscalyearname, fiscalperiodname, goalstartdate, goalenddate, targetmoney, actualmoney, inprogressmoney, targetdecimal, actualdecimal, inprogressdecimal, targetinteger, actualinteger, inprogressinteger, goalId, parentgoalid from (' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ') as G where GoalId = ' + ''''+@goalid+''''

          +'	UNION ALL
          -- Recursive member definition
          Select G1.title, G1.goalowneridname, G1.fiscalyearname, G1.fiscalperiodname, G1.goalstartdate, G1.goalenddate, G1.targetmoney, G1.actualmoney, G1.inprogressmoney, G1.actualdecimal, G1.targetdecimal,G1.inprogressdecimal, G1.targetinteger, G1.actualinteger, G1.inprogressinteger, G1.goalId, G1.parentgoalid from (' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ') G1 Inner join traverseSubTrees as t on t.GoalId = G1.ParentGoalId
           where (G1.statuscode != 2 or G1.statecode != 1)
          )
          select * from traverseSubTrees as t'
          Exec(@SQL)

        </CommandText><QueryParameters><QueryParameter Name="@goalid"><Value>=Parameters!goalid.Value</Value></QueryParameter><QueryParameter           Declare @SQL nVarchar(max)
          
          -- If an nVarchar(max) var is assigned using a concatenation of constant-length values, the result will be truncated to maintain
          -- backward compatibility with SQL Server 2000.  SQL's recommended workaround is to ensure that one of the concatenated values
          -- is of type nVarchar(max).  To address this, use @EmptyNvarcharMax in all assignments of @SQL1 and @SQL2 (proactively, in the
          -- case they aren't already assigned using concatenation).
          Declare @EmptyNvarcharMax nVarchar(max)
          Set @EmptyNvarcharMax = ''
          
          set @sql = @EmptyNvarcharMax + 'SELECT
          FilteredGoal.actualmoney
          ,FilteredGoal.inprogressmoney
          ,FilteredGoal.goalowneridname
          ,FilteredGoal.goalowneridyominame
          ,FilteredGoal.parentgoalid
          ,FilteredGoal.parentgoalidname
          ,FilteredGoal.targetmoney
          ,FilteredGoal.title
          ,FilteredGoal.goalstartdate
          ,FilteredGoal.goalenddate
          ,FilteredGoal.fiscalyear
          ,FilteredGoal.fiscalyearname
          ,FilteredGoal.fiscalperiod
          ,FilteredGoal.fiscalperiodname
          ,FilteredGoal.goalid
          ,FilteredGoal.metricid
          ,FilteredGoal.metricidname
          ,FilteredGoal.isamount
          ,FilteredGoal.amountdatatype
          ,FilteredGoal.amountdatatypename
          ,FilteredGoal.isamountname
          ,FilteredGoal.treeid
          ,FilteredGoal.inprogressdecimal
          ,FilteredGoal.inprogressinteger
          ,FilteredGoal.actualinteger
          ,FilteredGoal.actualdecimal
          ,FilteredGoal.targetdecimal
          ,FilteredGoal.targetinteger
          FROM
          (' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ') as FilteredGoal where goalid =' +  ''''+@goalid+''''
          + ' or
          FilteredGoal.parentgoalid =' + ''''+@goalid+''''
          + ' and (FilteredGoal.statuscode != 2 or FilteredGoal.statecode != 1)'
          Exec(@SQL)

          Declare @SQL nVarchar(max)
          
          -- If an nVarchar(max) var is assigned using a concatenation of constant-length values, the result will be truncated to maintain
          -- backward compatibility with SQL Server 2000.  SQL's recommended workaround is to ensure that one of the concatenated values
          -- is of type nVarchar(max).  To address this, use @EmptyNvarcharMax in all assignments of @SQL1 and @SQL2 (proactively, in the
          -- case they aren't already assigned using concatenation).
          Declare @EmptyNvarcharMax nVarchar(max)
          Set @EmptyNvarcharMax = ''

          set @sql = @EmptyNvarcharMax + '
          with traverseSubTrees( title, goalowneridname, fiscalyearname, fiscalperiodname, goalstartdate, goalenddate,targetmoney, actualmoney, inprogressmoney, targetdecimal, actualdecimal, inprogressdecimal, targetinteger, actualinteger, inprogressinteger, goalId, parentgoalid)As
          (
          --Anchor member
          Select title, goalowneridname, fiscalyearname, fiscalperiodname, goalstartdate, goalenddate, targetmoney, actualmoney, inprogressmoney, targetdecimal, actualdecimal, inprogressdecimal, targetinteger, actualinteger, inprogressinteger, goalId, parentgoalid from (' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ') as G where GoalId = ' + ''''+@goalid+''''

          +'	UNION ALL
          -- Recursive member definition
          Select G1.title, G1.goalowneridname, G1.fiscalyearname, G1.fiscalperiodname, G1.goalstartdate, G1.goalenddate, G1.targetmoney, G1.actualmoney, G1.inprogressmoney, G1.actualdecimal, G1.targetdecimal,G1.inprogressdecimal, G1.targetinteger, G1.actualinteger, G1.inprogressinteger, G1.goalId, G1.parentgoalid from (' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ') G1 Inner join traverseSubTrees as t on t.GoalId = G1.ParentGoalId
           where (G1.statuscode != 2 or G1.statecode != 1)
          )
          select * from traverseSubTrees as t'
          Exec(@SQL)

        </CommandText><QueryParameters><QueryParameter Name="@goalid"><Value>=Parameters!goalid.Value</Value></QueryParameter><QueryParameter defaultfilter: <ReportFilter><ReportEntity paramname="CRM_FilteredGoal"><fetch version="1.0" output-format="xml-platform" mapping="logical" distinct="false"><entity name="goal"><all-attributes /><filter type="and"><condition attribute="modifiedon" operator="last-x-days" value="30" /></filter></entity></fetch></ReportEntity></ReportFilter>
queryinfo:
<DataSets><DataSet Name="DataSet2"><Timeout /><CommandText>
          Declare @SQL nVarchar(max)
          
          -- If an nVarchar(max) var is assigned using a concatenation of constant-length values, the result will be truncated to maintain
          -- backward compatibility with SQL Server 2000.  SQL's recommended workaround is to ensure that one of the concatenated values
          -- is of type nVarchar(max).  To address this, use @EmptyNvarcharMax in all assignments of @SQL1 and @SQL2 (proactively, in the
          -- case they aren't already assigned using concatenation).
          Declare @EmptyNvarcharMax nVarchar(max)
          Set @EmptyNvarcharMax = ''
          
          set @sql = @EmptyNvarcharMax + 'SELECT
          FilteredGoal.actualmoney
          ,FilteredGoal.inprogressmoney
          ,FilteredGoal.goalowneridname
          ,FilteredGoal.goalowneridyominame
          ,FilteredGoal.parentgoalid
          ,FilteredGoal.parentgoalidname
          ,FilteredGoal.targetmoney
          ,FilteredGoal.title
          ,FilteredGoal.goalstartdate
          ,FilteredGoal.goalenddate
          ,FilteredGoal.fiscalyear
          ,FilteredGoal.fiscalyearname
          ,FilteredGoal.fiscalperiod
          ,FilteredGoal.fiscalperiodname
          ,FilteredGoal.goalid
          ,FilteredGoal.metricid
          ,FilteredGoal.metricidname
          ,FilteredGoal.isamount
          ,FilteredGoal.amountdatatype
          ,FilteredGoal.amountdatatypename
          ,FilteredGoal.isamountname
          ,FilteredGoal.treeid
          ,FilteredGoal.inprogressdecimal
          ,FilteredGoal.inprogressinteger
          ,FilteredGoal.actualinteger
          ,FilteredGoal.actualdecimal
          ,FilteredGoal.targetdecimal
          ,FilteredGoal.targetinteger
          FROM
          (' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ') as FilteredGoal where goalid =' +  ''''+@goalid+''''
          + ' or
          FilteredGoal.parentgoalid =' + ''''+@goalid+''''
          + ' and (FilteredGoal.statuscode != 2 or FilteredGoal.statecode != 1)'
          Exec(@SQL)
        </CommandText></DataSet><DataSet Name="DataSetForHierarchyTable"><Timeout /><CommandText>
          Declare @SQL nVarchar(max)
          
          -- If an nVarchar(max) var is assigned using a concatenation of constant-length values, the result will be truncated to maintain
          -- backward compatibility with SQL Server 2000.  SQL's recommended workaround is to ensure that one of the concatenated values
          -- is of type nVarchar(max).  To address this, use @EmptyNvarcharMax in all assignments of @SQL1 and @SQL2 (proactively, in the
          -- case they aren't already assigned using concatenation).
          Declare @EmptyNvarcharMax nVarchar(max)
          Set @EmptyNvarcharMax = ''

          set @sql = @EmptyNvarcharMax + '
          with traverseSubTrees( title, goalowneridname, fiscalyearname, fiscalperiodname, goalstartdate, goalenddate,targetmoney, actualmoney, inprogressmoney, targetdecimal, actualdecimal, inprogressdecimal, targetinteger, actualinteger, inprogressinteger, goalId, parentgoalid)As
          (
          --Anchor member
          Select title, goalowneridname, fiscalyearname, fiscalperiodname, goalstartdate, goalenddate, targetmoney, actualmoney, inprogressmoney, targetdecimal, actualdecimal, inprogressdecimal, targetinteger, actualinteger, inprogressinteger, goalId, parentgoalid from (' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ') as G where GoalId = ' + ''''+@goalid+''''

          +'	UNION ALL
          -- Recursive member definition
          Select G1.title, G1.goalowneridname, G1.fiscalyearname, G1.fiscalperiodname, G1.goalstartdate, G1.goalenddate, G1.targetmoney, G1.actualmoney, G1.inprogressmoney, G1.actualdecimal, G1.targetdecimal,G1.inprogressdecimal, G1.targetinteger, G1.actualinteger, G1.inprogressinteger, G1.goalId, G1.parentgoalid from (' + @CRM_FilteredGoal + ') G1 Inner join traverseSubTrees as t on t.GoalId = G1.ParentGoalId
           where (G1.statuscode != 2 or G1.statecode != 1)
          )
          select * from traverseSubTrees as t'
          Exec(@SQL)

        </CommandText></DataSet><DataSet Name="UserInfo"><Timeout /><CommandText>select fullname from FilteredSystemUser where systemuserid = dbo.fn_FindUserGuid()</CommandText></DataSet><DataSet Name="NumberandCurrencyFormat"><Timeout /><CommandText>select * from dbo.fn_GetFormatStrings()</CommandText></DataSet></DataSets>
